title: Drawing, "Table Lamp", 1928–29
markings: Stamps: Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Upper left quadrant, front view: LEVITON "REYLESS"/SOCKET (SMALL-2" LONG); left: SWITCH/WIRE OUTLET/THRU BUSHING; lower center: FRONT. Upper right quadrant, side view, to right, inscription referring to pivot of shade: UPRIGHT "A"/THICKNESS OF PIPE/PIVOT/SECTION/(FRONT)/SHADE TO TURN TO DOTTED POSITION; arrow leading to inscription above at center: SLOT 1 1/8 " LONG/PIVOT HERE; both in parentheses: ON 3 UPRIGHTS; center: OVAL HEAD/SCREWS; sideways: 1 1/2 R. Lower left quadrant, plan, with arrow: FLOOR PLAN CROSS HATCHED/; with arrow: LINE OF 1/2 OF 4 " DIAM PIPE. Lower right quadrant: F.S. DETAIL LAMP/; Donald Deskey stamp, in stamp, left: #331/BRUSH ALUM; center: DRAWN BY: F.S. (?); to right: F.S. (?)/1/19/32 (?): 3: 2 GNPT/1 OFF
description: Table lamp design showing front, side, and plan. Semi-circular, barrel-shaped shade intersecting with three upright shafts, supported by two extending feet arranged in L shape, one foot running parallel to shade, the other parallel to shaft.
